                            "content": "Yang salah adalah D (the prettier). Kalimat tersebut termasuk superlative degree, sedangkan 'the prettier' termasuk comparative degree. Ciri-ciri comparative degree adalah penggunaan kata 'than' dan di soal tidak ditemukan kata 'than' setelah the prettier. Jadi, bisa disimpulkan bahwa kalimat tsb bukanlah comparative degree, tetapi superlative degree. Seharusnya kalimat tsb menggunakan 'the prettiest'.",

Beckham was born on the 2nd of May 1975 in Leystone, London, England. He is the son of a kitchen fitter and a hairdresser.                         "content": "Soal SImak UI Bahasa Inggris The unmistakable buzz of a bumblebee is one of the quintessential sounds of British summertime. However, this slender sound and faint utterance is under threat because bumblebees are in crisis. Of the 25 species native to Britain, three have already been declared extinct, five are designated UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species, and many more have undergone major range contractions. The great yellow bumblebee, Bombus destinguendus, for example, is now restricted to northern Scotland, Orkney and the Hebrides, and the shirll carder bee, Bombus sylvarum, which was once common throughout southern Britain, now exists only in seven small groups. In addition, as these populations become more isolated they can become inbred, which increase the risk of further extinctions.<br \/>\nAt the end of summer all the bumblebees in a colony die, apart from the virgin queens who mate and then leaves the nest to hibernate over winter. In the spring a queen will make new nest, lay eggs and then raise the first batch of workers. This annual cycle depends on there being enough pollen and nectar to sustain the queen as she establishes her nest and team of workers as the colony grows. Pollen is a protein rich fuel that is key to helping over wintered queens to kick start their reproductive systems ready and for the development of larvae. Nectar, on the other hand, is asugar rich fuel which is converted to honey to feed adult bees. The bees make honey by adding to the nectar in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose sugars to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers are develop, they take over the foraging and the queen concentrates on laying eggs. Later in the year, if the colony has been successful and reaches a large enough size, the queen will produce male eggs and some female eggs are raised as new queens.<br \/>\nA lack of resources is thought to be the critical factor that is affecting bumblebee populations, and it is related to the loss of wild flowers, both in the countryside and in vast suburban gardens. The biggest impact has been the availability of food and drink, in particular the continuity of supplies throughout the colony cycle. Although nectar is available from a wide range of plants, the bees can be much more choosy about where they collect pollen from, sometimes restricting this to very few flowering plants. In Scotland, overwintered queens of the declining and beautiful bilberry bumblebee focus on bilberry in spring. Other species may focus on legumes such as red clover and bird\u2019s foot trefoil. Sadly, because the UK has lost 98% of its flower rich grasslands, this has been devastating for some bumblebee species. <br \/>\nGunakan Petunjuk A dalam menjawab soal nomor 43 sampai nomor 47.<br \/>\n43. What is the best title of the passage?   <br \/>\nA.        The Bumblebee\u2019s Life Cycle<br \/>\nB.        The different Bumblebee species<br \/>\nC.        A drop in Bumblebee Population<br \/>\nD.        The responsibility of a Bumblebee Queen<br \/>\nE.        The impact of the Loss of the UK\u2019s Grasslands<br \/>",
                        "created": "2016-05-31T19:52:03+07:00",
                        "responses": 1,
                        "tickets": 1,
                        "first_resp": "2016-06-02T13:27:46+07:00",
                        "the_best_resp_id": null,
                        "source": "10",

                            "can_moderate": false,
                            "is_marked_abuse": false,

                        "highlighted_content": "Soal SImak UI Bahasa Inggris The unmistakable buzz of a bumblebee is one of the quintessential sounds of British summertime. However, this slender sound and faint utterance is under threat because bumblebees are in crisis. Of the 25 species native to Britain, three have already been declared extinct, five are designated UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species, and many more have undergone major range contractions. The great yellow bumblebee, Bombus destinguendus, for example, is now restricted to northern Scotland, Orkney and the Hebrides, and the shirll carder bee, Bombus sylvarum, which was once common throughout southern Britain, now exists only in seven small groups. In addition, as these populations become more isolated they can become inbred, which increase the risk of further extinctions.\nAt the end of summer all the bumblebees in a colony die, apart from the virgin queens who mate and then leaves the nest to hibernate over winter. In the spring a queen will make new nest, lay eggs and then raise the first batch of workers. This annual cycle depends on there being enough pollen and nectar to sustain the queen as she establishes her nest and team of workers as the colony grows. Pollen is a protein rich fuel that is key to helping over wintered queens to kick start their reproductive systems ready and for the development of larvae. Nectar, on the other hand, is asugar rich fuel which is converted to honey to feed adult bees. The bees make honey by adding to the nectar in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose <em>suga<\/em>rs to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers are develop, they take over the foraging and the queen concentrates on laying eggs. Later in the year, if the colony has been successful and reaches a large enough size, the queen will produce male eggs and some female eggs are raised as new queens.\nA lack of resources is thought to be the critical factor that is affecting bumblebee populations, and it is related to the loss of wild flowers, both in the countryside and in vast suburban gardens. The biggest impact has been the availability of food and drink, in particular the continuity of supplies throughout the colony cycle. Although nectar is available from a wide range of plants, the bees can be much more choosy about where they collect pollen from, sometimes restricting this to very few flowering plants. In Scotland, overwintered queens of the declining and beautiful bilberry bumblebee focus on bilberry in spring. Other species may focus on legumes such as red clover and bird\u2019s foot trefoil. Sadly, because the UK has <em>lost<\/em> 98% of its flower rich grasslands, this has been devastating for some bumblebee species. \nGunakan Petunjuk A dalam menjawab soal nomor 43 sampai nomor 47.\n43. What is the best title of the passage?   \nA.        The Bumblebee\u2019s Life Cycle\nB.        The different Bumblebee species\nC.        A drop in Bumblebee Population\nD.        The responsibility of a Bumblebee Queen\nE.        The impact of the Loss of the UK\u2019s Grasslands",
                        "snippet_content": "in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose <em>suga<\/em>rs to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers"
                    },

                        "content": "Soal SImak UI Bahasa Inggris  The unmistakable buzz of a bumblebee is one of the quintessential sounds of British summertime. However, this slender sound and faint utterance is under threat because bumblebees are in crisis. Of the 25 species native to Britain, three have already been declared extinct, five are designated UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species, and many more have undergone major range contractions. The great yellow bumblebee, Bombus destinguendus, for example, is now restricted to northern Scotland, Orkney and the Hebrides, and the shirll carder bee, Bombus sylvarum, which was once common throughout southern Britain, now exists only in seven small groups. In addition, as these populations become more isolated they can become inbred, which increase the risk of further extinctions.<br \/>\nAt the end of summer all the bumblebees in a colony die, apart from the virgin queens who mate and then leaves the nest to hibernate over winter. In the spring a queen will make new nest, lay eggs and then raise the first batch of workers. This annual cycle depends on there being enough pollen and nectar to sustain the queen as she establishes her nest and team of workers as the colony grows. Pollen is a protein rich fuel that is key to helping over wintered queens to kick start their reproductive systems ready and for the development of larvae. Nectar, on the other hand, is asugar rich fuel which is converted to honey to feed adult bees. The bees make honey by adding to the nectar in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose sugars to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers are develop, they take over the foraging and the queen concentrates on laying eggs. Later in the year, if the colony has been successful and reaches a large enough size, the queen will produce male eggs and some female eggs are raised as new queens.<br \/>\nA lack of resources is thought to be the critical factor that is affecting bumblebee populations, and it is related to the loss of wild flowers, both in the countryside and in vast suburban gardens. The biggest impact has been the availability of food and drink, in particular the continuity of supplies throughout the colony cycle. Although nectar is available from a wide range of plants, the bees can be much more choosy about where they collect pollen from, sometimes restricting this to very few flowering plants. In Scotland, overwintered queens of the declining and beautiful bilberry bumblebee focus on bilberry in spring. Other species may focus on legumes such as red clover and bird\u2019s foot trefoil. Sadly, because the UK has lost 98% of its flower rich grasslands, this has been devastating for some bumblebee species. <br \/>\nThe word \u2018undergone\u2019 in line 4 can best be replaced by ...   <br \/>\nA.        Dealt with<br \/>\nB.        Confronted<br \/>\nC.        Estimated<br \/>\nD.        Experienced<br \/>\nE.        Coped with<br \/>",

                        "highlighted_content": "Soal SImak UI Bahasa Inggris The unmistakable buzz of a bumblebee is one of the quintessential sounds of British summertime. However, this slender sound and faint utterance is under threat because bumblebees are in crisis. Of the 25 species native to Britain, three have already been declared extinct, five are designated UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species, and many more have undergone major range contractions. The great yellow bumblebee, Bombus destinguendus, for example, is now restricted to northern Scotland, Orkney and the Hebrides, and the shirll carder bee, Bombus sylvarum, which was once common throughout southern Britain, now exists only in seven small groups. In addition, as these populations become more isolated they can become inbred, which increase the risk of further extinctions.\nAt the end of summer all the bumblebees in a colony die, apart from the virgin queens who mate and then leaves the nest to hibernate over winter. In the spring a queen will make new nest, lay eggs and then raise the first batch of workers. This annual cycle depends on there being enough pollen and nectar to sustain the queen as she establishes her nest and team of workers as the colony grows. Pollen is a protein rich fuel that is key to helping over wintered queens to kick start their reproductive systems ready and for the development of larvae. Nectar, on the other hand, is asugar rich fuel which is converted to honey to feed adult bees. The bees make honey by adding to the nectar in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose <em>suga<\/em>rs to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers are develop, they take over the foraging and the queen concentrates on laying eggs. Later in the year, if the colony has been successful and reaches a large enough size, the queen will produce male eggs and some female eggs are raised as new queens.\nA lack of resources is thought to be the critical factor that is affecting bumblebee populations, and it is related to the loss of wild flowers, both in the countryside and in vast suburban gardens. The biggest impact has been the availability of food and drink, in particular the continuity of supplies throughout the colony cycle. Although nectar is available from a wide range of plants, the bees can be much more choosy about where they collect pollen from, sometimes restricting this to very few flowering plants. In Scotland, overwintered queens of the declining and beautiful bilberry bumblebee focus on bilberry in spring. Other species may focus on legumes such as red clover and bird\u2019s foot trefoil. Sadly, because the UK has <em>lost<\/em> 98% of its flower rich grasslands, this has been devastating for some bumblebee species. \nWhat can be inferred from the passage about the lifecycle of bumblebee?    \nA.        The new workers are brought up by the male bees.\nB.        Bumblebees hibernate throughout winter to survive.\nC.        The virgin queens survive the summer and then continue the reproduction.\nD.        All the bumblebee in a colony die when summer ends.\nThe continuation of the lifecycle depends on the skill of the queens in collecting food.",

                        "content": "Soal SImak UI Bahasa Inggris The unmistakable buzz of a bumblebee is one of the quintessential sounds of British summertime. However, this slender sound and faint utterance is under threat because bumblebees are in crisis. Of the 25 species native to Britain, three have already been declared extinct, five are designated UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species, and many more have undergone major range contractions. The great yellow bumblebee, Bombus destinguendus, for example, is now restricted to northern Scotland, Orkney and the Hebrides, and the shirll carder bee, Bombus sylvarum, which was once common throughout southern Britain, now exists only in seven small groups. In addition, as these populations become more isolated they can become inbred, which increase the risk of further extinctions.<br \/>\nAt the end of summer all the bumblebees in a colony die, apart from the virgin queens who mate and then leaves the nest to hibernate over winter. In the spring a queen will make new nest, lay eggs and then raise the first batch of workers. This annual cycle depends on there being enough pollen and nectar to sustain the queen as she establishes her nest and team of workers as the colony grows. Pollen is a protein rich fuel that is key to helping over wintered queens to kick start their reproductive systems ready and for the development of larvae. Nectar, on the other hand, is asugar rich fuel which is converted to honey to feed adult bees. The bees make honey by adding to the nectar in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose sugars to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers are develop, they take over the foraging and the queen concentrates on laying eggs. Later in the year, if the colony has been successful and reaches a large enough size, the queen will produce male eggs and some female eggs are raised as new queens.<br \/>\nA lack of resources is thought to be the critical factor that is affecting bumblebee populations, and it is related to the loss of wild flowers, both in the countryside and in vast suburban gardens. The biggest impact has been the availability of food and drink, in particular the continuity of supplies throughout the colony cycle. Although nectar is available from a wide range of plants, the bees can be much more choosy about where they collect pollen from, sometimes restricting this to very few flowering plants. In Scotland, overwintered queens of the declining and beautiful bilberry bumblebee focus on bilberry in spring. Other species may focus on legumes such as red clover and bird\u2019s foot trefoil. Sadly, because the UK has lost 98% of its flower rich grasslands, this has been devastating for some bumblebee species.  Why did the writer mention the queens of bilberry bumblebee?  <br \/>\nA.        To describe how a bumblebee may look like<br \/>\nB.        To give example of bees which can survive the winter<br \/>\nC.        To show one species of bees whose food resource is declining<br \/>\nD.        To give an example of a species of bumblebees which is declining<br \/>\nE.        To give an example of bees which are very selective about source of pollen<br \/>",

However, this slender sound and faint utterance is under threat because bumblebees are in crisis. Of the 25 species native to Britain, three have already been declared extinct, five are designated UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species, and many more have undergone major range contractions. The great yellow bumblebee, Bombus destinguendus, for example, is now restricted to northern Scotland, Orkney and the Hebrides, and the shirll carder bee, Bombus sylvarum, which was once common throughout southern Britain, now exists only in seven small groups. In addition, as these populations become more isolated they can become inbred, which increase the risk of further extinctions.\nAt the end of summer all the bumblebees in a colony die, apart from the virgin queens who mate and then leaves the nest to hibernate over winter. In the spring a queen will make new nest, lay eggs and then raise the first batch of workers. This annual cycle depends on there being enough pollen and nectar to sustain the queen as she establishes her nest and team of workers as the colony grows. Pollen is a protein rich fuel that is key to helping over wintered queens to kick start their reproductive systems ready and for the development of larvae. Nectar, on the other hand, is asugar rich fuel which is converted to honey to feed adult bees. The bees make honey by adding to the nectar in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose <em>suga<\/em>rs to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers are develop, they take over the foraging and the queen concentrates on laying eggs. Later in the year, if the colony has been successful and reaches a large enough size, the queen will produce male eggs and some female eggs are raised as new queens.\nA lack of resources is thought to be the critical factor that is affecting bumblebee populations, and it is related to the loss of wild flowers, both in the countryside and in vast suburban gardens. The biggest impact has been the availability of food and drink, in particular the continuity of supplies throughout the colony cycle. Although nectar is available from a wide range of plants, the bees can be much more choosy about where they collect pollen from, sometimes restricting this to very few flowering plants. In Scotland, overwintered queens of the declining and beautiful bilberry bumblebee focus on bilberry in spring. Other species may focus on legumes such as red clover and bird\u2019s foot trefoil. Sadly, because the UK has <em>lost<\/em> 98% of its flower rich grasslands, this has been devastating for some bumblebee species. To give an example of bees which are very selective about source of pollen",

However, this slender sound and faint utterance is under threat because bumblebees are in crisis. Of the 25 species native to Britain, three have already been declared extinct, five are designated UK Biodiversity Action Plan priority species, and many more have undergone major range contractions. The great yellow bumblebee, Bombus destinguendus, for example, is now restricted to northern Scotland, Orkney and the Hebrides, and the shirll carder bee, Bombus sylvarum, which was once common throughout southern Britain, now exists only in seven small groups. In the spring a queen will make new nest, lay eggs and then raise the first batch of workers. This annual cycle depends on there being enough pollen and nectar to sustain the queen as she establishes her nest and team of workers as the colony grows. Pollen is a protein rich fuel that is key to helping over wintered queens to kick start their reproductive systems ready and for the development of larvae. Nectar, on the other hand, is asugar rich fuel which is converted to honey to feed adult bees. The bees make honey by adding to the nectar in their honey sacs an enzyme called invertase, which converts sucrose sugars to a mixture of glucose and fructose. Once the workers are develop, they take over the foraging and the queen concentrates on laying eggs. Later in the year, if the colony has been successful and reaches a large enough size, the queen will produce male eggs and some female eggs are raised as new queens.<br \/>\nA lack of resources is thought to be the critical factor that is affecting bumblebee populations, and it is related to the loss of wild flowers, both in the countryside and in vast suburban gardens. The biggest impact has been the availability of food and drink, in particular the continuity of supplies throughout the colony cycle. Although nectar is available from a wide range of plants, the bees can be much more choosy about where they collect pollen from, sometimes restricting this to very few flowering plants. In Scotland, overwintered queens of the declining and beautiful bilberry bumblebee focus on bilberry in spring. Other species may focus on legumes such as red clover and bird\u2019s foot trefoil.                         "content": "Illegal Logging<br \/><br \/>\nIllegal Logging is really a problematic case in this country. There are three reasons why it is the case.<br \/><br \/>\nPembalakan liar adalah permasalahan yang berat di negeri ini. Ada tiga alasan kenapa bisa seperti ini.<br \/><br \/>\nFirstly, the illegal logging has threatened the people who live in the countryside around or under the area. The bald forest or hills make a big danger when the rainy seasons come. The great quantity of water can create landslides since there are no enough trees to hold the water and land. We have seen the landslide disasters which happened in many areas in Indonesia. The number of the areas struck by landslide has increased.<br \/><br \/>\nPertama, penebangan liar mengancam orang orang yang tinggal di pedesaan atau di bawah area tersebut. Hutan gundul atau bukit membuat sebuah bahaya yang besar ketika musim hujan datang. Jumlah air yang besar dapat mengakibatkan lonsor karena tidak ada cukup tumbuhan untuk menahan air dan daratan. Kita telah melihat bencana longsor yang terjadi di banyak area di Indonesia. Jumlah area yang terkena telah meningkat.<br \/><br \/>\nThe second reason is that the uncontrolled trees felling seems to go on without any significant effort of the government to stop it. According to some news sources in Newspaper and news program on TV, the activities of illegal cutting of the trees in some regions are actually known by the government officers. The police and local government let them cut the threes because they are given much money for themselves. They do not think their actions endanger the people around the forests. Therefore, it can be said that illegal logging is illegal but known by the officers.<br \/><br \/>\nAlasan kedua adalah tumbangnya pohon yang tak terkontrol nampaknya terus berlanjut tanpa ada usuha yang significant dari pemerintah untuk menghentikannya. Berdasarkan beberapa berita di Koran dan program berita di TV, aktivitas penebangan hutan di beberapa daerah diketahui oleh pemerintah. Polisi dan pemerintah setempat membiarkan pembalak tersebut memetong pohon karena mereka juga diberikan uang oleh penebang. Mereka tidak sadar perbuatan mereka membahayakan orang sekitar hutan. Karena itu, pembalakan ini dapat dikatakan illegal akan tetapi diketahui oleh pejabat.<br \/><br \/>\nThe third is that the illegal logging of the forest trees can destroy the natural ecosystem. When the forest trees are continuously cut and the rein forestation is not done as the rule, the natural ecosystem is in a terrible danger. The system which is formed by the interaction between a community of organisms, including humans and animals, and their physical environment will be threatened. Human beings in several villages have been killed. Wide areas of farms are destroyed by the piles of mud and thousands of farm animals are killed and lost. Who are suffering ?<br \/><br \/>\nDan yang ketiga adalah penebangan liar di hutan dapat merusak ekosistem alam. Ketika pohon hutan ditebangi terus menerus dan penanaman kembali tidak dilakukan menurut aturan, ekosistem alam akan berada dalam permasalahan besar. System yang terbentuk dengan hubungan antara komunitas makhluk hidup, termasuk manusia dan binatang dan lingkungan akan terancam. Manusia di beberapa desa telah terbunuh. Area luas pertanian dirusak oeh setumpukan lumpur dan ribuan binatang ternak terbunuh dan mati. Siapa yang menderita ?<br \/><br \/>\nBased on the given reasons, uncontrolled illegal logging is a serious problem that needs to be solved immediately by both the government and citizens as the owners of the forest.<br \/><br \/>\nBerdasarkan alasan diatas, penebangan hutan yang tidak terkendali adalah masalah yang perlu diselesaikan segera oleh pemerintah dan masyarakat sebagai pemilik hutan . <br \/>\n1. How many arguments are presented in the written exposition above ? <br \/>\n2. Whose lives are threatened by the illegal logging ? <br \/>\n3. In what season do landslides usually happen ? why ? <br \/>\n4. Have the local government done something to prevent illegal logging ? <br \/>\n5. Can you mention the losses or victims of landslides ? <br \/>\n6. Why illegal logging destroy the natural ecosystem ? <br \/>\n7. Why must the problem of illegal logging be solved soon ? <br \/>\n8. Do you know the best way to handle this problem ? <br \/>\n9. What do some people do illegal logging for ? <br \/>\n10. What is your personal opinion about illegal logging ?",

                        "highlighted_content": "Illegal Logging\nIllegal Logging is really a problematic case in this country. There are three reasons why it is the case.\nPembalakan liar adalah permasalahan yang berat di negeri ini. Ada tiga alasan kenapa bisa seperti ini.\nFirstly, the illegal logging has threatened the people who live in the countryside around or under the area. The bald forest or hills make a big danger when the rainy seasons come. The great quantity of water can create landslides since there are no enough trees to hold the water and land. We have seen the landslide disasters which happened in many areas in Indonesia. The number of the areas struck by landslide has increased.\nPertama, penebangan liar mengancam orang orang yang tinggal di pedesaan atau di bawah area tersebut. Hutan gundul atau bukit membuat sebuah bahaya yang besar ketika musim hujan datang. Jumlah air yang besar dapat mengakibatkan lonsor karena tidak ada cukup tumbuhan untuk menahan air dan daratan. Kita telah melihat bencana longsor yang terjadi di banyak area di Indonesia. Jumlah area yang terkena telah meningkat.\nThe second reason is that the uncontrolled trees felling seems to go on without any significant effort of the government to stop it. According to some news sources in Newspaper and news program on TV, the activities of illegal cutting of the trees in some regions are actually known by the government officers. The police and local government let them cut the threes because they are given much money for themselves. They do not think their actions endanger the people around the forests. Therefore, it can be said that illegal logging is illegal but known by the officers.\nAlasan kedua adalah tumbangnya pohon yang tak terkontrol nampaknya terus berlanjut tanpa ada usuha yang significant dari pemerintah untuk menghentikannya. Berdasarkan beberapa berita di Koran dan program berita di TV, aktivitas penebangan hutan di beberapa daerah diketahui oleh pemerintah. Polisi dan pemerintah setempat membiarkan pembalak tersebut memetong pohon karena mereka juga diberikan uang oleh penebang. Mereka tidak <em>sada<\/em>r perbuatan mereka membahayakan orang sekitar hutan. Karena itu, pembalakan ini dapat dikatakan illegal akan tetapi diketahui oleh pejabat.\nThe third is that the illegal logging of the forest trees can destroy the natural ecosystem. When the forest trees are continuously cut and the rein forestation is not done as the rule, the natural ecosystem is in a terrible danger. The system which is formed by the interaction between a community of organisms, including humans and animals, and their physical environment will be threatened. Human beings in several villages have been killed. Wide areas of farms are destroyed by the piles of mud and thousands of farm animals are killed and <em>lost.<\/em> Who are suffering ?\nDan yang ketiga adalah penebangan liar di hutan dapat merusak ekosistem alam. Ketika pohon hutan ditebangi terus menerus dan penanaman kembali tidak dilakukan menurut aturan, ekosistem alam akan berada dalam permasalahan besar. System yang terbentuk dengan hubungan antara komunitas makhluk hidup, termasuk manusia dan binatang dan lingkungan akan terancam. Manusia di beberapa desa telah terbunuh. Area luas pertanian dirusak oeh setumpukan lumpur dan ribuan binatang ternak terbunuh dan mati. Siapa yang menderita ?\nBased on the given reasons, uncontrolled illegal logging is a serious problem that needs to be solved immediately by both the government and citizens as the owners of the forest.\nBerdasarkan alasan diatas, penebangan hutan yang tidak terkendali adalah masalah yang perlu diselesaikan segera oleh pemerintah dan masyarakat sebagai pemilik hutan . \n1. How many arguments are presented in the written exposition above ? \n2. Whose lives are threatened by the illegal logging ? \n3. In what season do landslides usually happen ? why ? \n4. Have the local government done something to prevent illegal logging ? \n5. Can you mention the losses or victims of landslides ? \n6. Why illegal logging destroy the natural ecosystem ? \n7. Why must the problem of illegal logging be solved soon ? \n8. Do you know the best way to handle this problem ? \n9. What do some people do illegal logging for ? \n10. What is your personal opinion about illegal logging ?",

                    "responses": [
                        {
                            "id": 12216941,
                            "user_id": 4836494,
                            "task_id": 10148669,
                            "points": 5,
                            "created": "2017-04-05T12:19:46+07:00",
                            "content": "Memodifikasi rancangan Form5.5.1 Merubah posisi field pada sebuah rancangan FormLangkah-langkahnya adalah:<br \/><br \/>1.\tBuka file database yang diinginkan (Karyawan), kemudian pada window kerja database klik Forms yang ada di bawah Objects atau pilih dan klik menu View, Database Objects, Forms.<br \/><br \/>2.\tPilih dan klik nama form yang diinginkan (Form Data Karyawan), kemudian klik tombol toolbar Design. Window kerja perancangan form akan ditampilkan.<br \/><br \/>Catatan: Pada window perancangan form tersebut sebaiknya field list dan toolbox ditampilkan<br \/><br \/>3.\tUntuk menempatkan field pada rancangan form, geser (drag) nama field yang Anda inginkan dari field list ke posisi yang diinginkan.<br \/><br \/>Catatan:<br \/>\u2022\tUntuk memilih beberapa field sekaligus, sambil menekan tombol Ctrl, pilih dan klik field-field yang diinginkan.<br \/><br \/>\u2022\tApabila ingin mengganti Data Source-nya pada toolbar Objects, pilih dan klik Form. Kemudian pilih dan klik tombol toolbar Properties. Pada kotak dialog tersebut, klik tab Data, selanjutnya pada tombol daftar pilihan Record Source, pilih dan klik tabel yang diinginkan.<br \/><br \/>4. Simpan hasil modifikasi tersebut dengan nama FormDatKar , dengan cara pilih dan klik menu File, Save As.<br \/><br \/>5.\tUntuk melihat tampilan formnya, klik tombol toolbar Form View.5.5.2 Menempatkan label pada header dan footerLangkah-langkahnya adalah:<br \/><br \/>1.\tPilih dan klik nama form yang diinginkan (Form Data Karyawan), kemudian klik tombol toolbar Design. Window kerja perancangan form akan ditampilkan.<br \/><br \/>2.\tForm Header\/Footer berisi label atau informasi yang ingin ditampilkan ulang pada setiap form di layar. Untuk menampilkan area form header\/footer, pilih dan klik menu View, Form Header\/Footer.<br \/><br \/>3.\tPage Header\/Footer berisi label atau informasi yang ingin ditampilkan ulang pada setiap halaman pencetakan. Untuk menampilkan area page header\/footer, pilih dan klik menu View, Page Header\/Footer.<br \/><br \/>4.\tPada toolbox klik tombol Label (penunjuk mouse ditampilkan dengan simbol A), kemudian klik penunjuk mouse tersebut pada posisi label yang diinginkan.<br \/><br \/>5.\tSetelah titik sisip (insertion point) ditempatkan pada Form Header\/Footer, ketikkan teks yang Anda inginkan.Misalnya pada bagian Form Header ketikkan PT. ANTARNET dan di bawahnya ketikkan Jl. Balai Pustaka Barat No.60 JAKARTA. Simpan dengan nama FormDatKarHeader, dengan cara pilih dan klik menu File, Save As pada kotak isian ketikkan nama baru tersebut.",

                        "grade_id": 2,

                            "ptsForTask": 20,
                            "ptsForResp": 10,
                            "ptsForBest": 5
                        },
                        "content": "Bantu ya, please.<br \/>\nREAD THE TEXT, THEN STATE TRUE OR FLASE )                                                       <br \/>\n                                                Durian<br \/>\nDurian is classified as durio zibethinus. It is native to southeast asia. Durian is known as \u2018king of fruits\u2019. It is not only the most expensive fruit but also the most controversial fruit. It is the only fruit which is banned from airline cabins, hotels and some public transports.<br \/><br \/>\nthe durian tree is large and very tall. It can grow up to 20-25 meters and it has green elliptical leaves. A durian tree usually can bear fruit after four or five years. The durian fruit, which can hang-from  any branches, matures in about three months after pollination. The fruit can grow up to 30 centimeters long and 15 centimeters in diameter. <br \/><br \/>\nthe husk is covered with sharp thorns. The color of the husk ranges from green to brown. The flesh is pale  yellow. It is very soft but not juicy, when it is ripe, it tastes sweet and smells very strong.<br \/>\n Durian contains a lot of sugar, vitamin c, and potassium. Durian is also  a good source of carbohydrates, proteins, and fats. Durian is usually eaten flesh. Sometimes it is also cooked to make \u2018 dodol\u2019 or jam. Durian used to be grown from seeds, but now it is propagated by grafiting. <br \/><br \/>\nquestion : <br \/>\n1) When we\u2019re staying in the hotel, we are forbidden to bring durian. ( true\/ false )<br \/>\n2) Durian isn\u2019t an expensive fruit. ( true\/ false )<br \/>\n3) The fruit of durian is ripe in the tree ( true\/ false )<br \/>\n4) There are many sharp thorns inside the fruit ( true \/false )<br \/>\n5) The flesh of durian has strong smell ( true\/ false )<br \/>\n6) Durian is good for our body, because it contains a lot of vitamin ( true\/ false )<br \/>\n7) People may cook durian to make durian jam ( true\/ false )<br \/>\n8) It\u2019 s delicious to eat durian in fresh condition ( true\/ false )<br \/>\n9) Nowadays, people can grow durian only from the seeds. It is native to southeast asia. Durian is known as \u2018king of fruits\u2019. It is not only the most expensive fruit but also the most controversial fruit. It is the only fruit which is banned from airline cabins, hotels and some public transports.\nthe durian tree is large and very tall. It can grow up to 20-25 meters and it has green elliptical leaves. A durian tree usually can bear fruit after four or five years. The durian fruit, which can hang-from  any branches, matures in about three months after pollination. The fruit can grow up to 30 centimeters long and 15 centimeters in diameter. \nthe husk is covered with sharp thorns. The color of the husk ranges from green to brown. The flesh is pale  yellow. It is very soft but not juicy, when it is ripe, it tastes sweet and smells very strong.\n Durian contains a <em>lot<\/em> of <em>suga<\/em>r, vitamin c, and potassium. Durian is also  a good source of carbohydrates, proteins, and fats. Durian is usually eaten flesh. Sometimes it is also cooked to make \u2018 dodol\u2019 or jam. Durian used to be grown from seeds, but now it is propagated by grafiting. \nquestion : \n1) When we\u2019re staying in the hotel, we are forbidden to bring durian. ( true\/ false )\n2) Durian isn\u2019t an expensive fruit.                         },
                        "content": "Tolong artikan <br \/>\nWhen I was seven years old, I was given a small wallet to keep my pocket money in. I felt so happy and put it in my hip pocket.<br \/>\nOne day, during the break time at school, I discovered that my wallet was missing. I checked it but I could not find it. There was some money in the wallet and without it I could not buy anything to eat. I was close to tears. It was not because of losing my precious wallet but because I might get scolded by my parents. Anyhow I went hungry that day.<br \/>\nIn the class I could not concentrate well to study at all. I kept thinking about how I lost my wallet and what my parents would react. How was I going to explain the loss? I did not know whether someone had taken it from my pocket or it had merely fallen out. I hoped that someone would find and return it to me.<br \/>\nWhen I told my mother about my loss, she was angry. She told me that it would not have happend if I had been careful. When my father came home, I got another anger. Then he told me that there would not be any more wallets for me until I got older.<br \/>\nLuckily, I still got pocket money from my parents. I am glad to say that I never lost anything again. I had learned to be more careful. It is not pleasant to lose something and then get scolded for losing it. ",

Suatu hari, selama waktu istirahat di sekolah, saya menemukan bahwa dompet saya hilang. Aku memeriksa, tapi aku tidak bisa menemukannya. Ada beberapa uang dalam dompet dan tanpa itu saya tidak bisa membeli sesuatu untuk dimakan. Aku hampir menangis. Itu bukan karena kehilangan dompet saya yang berharga tapi karena aku mungkin akan dimarahi oleh orang tua saya. Bagaimanapun aku pergi lapar hari itu. Di kelas saya tidak bisa berkonsentrasi dengan baik untuk belajar sama sekali. Aku terus berpikir tentang bagaimana saya kehilangan dompet dan apa yang orang tua saya akan bereaksi. Bagaimana saya akan menjelaskan kerugian? Aku tidak tahu apakah seseorang telah diambil dari saku saya atau itu hanyalah jatuh. Saya berharap bahwa seseorang akan menemukan dan mengembalikannya kepada saya. Ketika saya mengatakan ibu saya tentang kehilangan saya, dia marah. Dia mengatakan kepada saya bahwa itu tidak akan terjadi jika saya telah berhati-hati. Ketika ayah saya pulang, saya mendapat kemarahan lain. Kemudian dia mengatakan kepada saya bahwa tidak akan ada dompet lebih untuk saya sampai saya mendapat lebih tua. Untungnya, aku masih punya uang saku dari orang tua saya. Saya senang untuk mengatakan bahwa saya tidak pernah kehilangan apa-apa lagi. Saya telah belajar untuk lebih berhati-hati.
